title: How to Make Leftover Beverage Fruitcake

steps.headline: Tip the fruit mixture into a large mixing bowl.
steps.description: Pour the leftover beverage over the fruit. Set aside to soak overnight.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 200ºC/400ºF.
steps.description: Prepare the baking tin or pan by lining it with baking/parchment paper.

steps.headline: Mix the flour into the soaking fruit mix.
steps.description: Keep mixing carefully until it's thoroughly combined.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture into the baking tin.
Turn down the oven to 150ºC/300ºF.
steps.description: Slip the cake in to bake for 1 1/2 hours. The cake is ready when a skewer inserted into it comes out clean.

steps.headline: Cool the cake out of the tin on a wire cooling rack.

text: Tip the fruit mixture into a large mixing bowl. Pour the leftover beverage over the fruit. Set aside to soak overnight. Preheat the oven to 200ºC/400ºF. Prepare the baking tin or pan by lining it with baking/parchment paper. Mix the flour into the soaking fruit mix. Keep mixing carefully until it's thoroughly combined. Pour the mixture into the baking tin.  Turn down the oven to 150ºC/300ºF. Slip the cake in to bake for 1 1/2 hours. The cake is ready when a skewer inserted into it comes out clean. Cool the cake out of the tin on a wire cooling rack.  Serve.
